Name: Exhibit -- The Iron Horse of the Prairie State
description: The Illinois History and Lincoln Collections is pleased to present The Iron Horse of the Prairie State, an exhibit that explores the evolution of the railroad in Illinoiss history. The exhibit showcases the IHLCs holdings related to railroads, from their inception when railroad fever struck Illinois in the 1830s to today.

Name: SKY Happiness
description: What is the SKY Happiness Retreat? SKY Happiness Retreat is a holistic happiness and well-being program taught over 3 days on campus which trains participants in the evidence-based SKY meditation practice, breathing techniques, yoga, social connection and mindful leadership. SKY has been shown to significantly reduce anxiety and depression, lower stress markers, and inc

Name: Music Barn Festival: Songs Along the Sangamon - Allerton Park Concert Series
description: MUSIC BARN FESTIVAL: SONGS ALONG THE SANGAMON  ALLERTON PARK CONCERT SERIES Join the University of Illinois School of Music during this candlelit weekend of crickets, cocktails, and rich music in Allertons idyllic Music Barn. Purchase tickets here.

Name: Physics at the Market
Location: Urbana's Market at the Square: Corner of Illinois and Vine St.
description: Ask a UIUC physicist your questions about the universe and how it works! Come see a super conductor make a magnet float! There are also singing magnets, florescence, wave propagation, reference frames, event horizons, and more!

Name: KAM Exhibition | All This Beauty and Color: Highlights from the WPA
description: This exhibition showcases a selection of paintings created by American artists who were employed as part of the New Deal Works Progress Administration. This art is on long term loan to Krannert Art Museum from the United States Government and is cared for as part of the museum collection.

Name: KAM Exhibition | Art Since 1948
Location: Main Level, Rosann Gelvin Noel Gallery
description: With strengths in surrealism, abstract painting, mid-century kinetic and light works, and art addressing powerful themes of history, land use, and identity, "Art Since 1948" surveys the collection and encourages formal and conceptual connections across six decades.

Name: KAM Exhibition | Reinstallation of European and American Art
Location: Main Level, Bow and Trees Galleries
description: The Bow and Trees Galleries, which have been freshly painted with new colors, feature thoughtful reinterpretations of KAMs collection of European and American art from the 1300s to 1950.

Name: KAM Exhibition | Revealing Presence: Women in Architecture at the University of Illinois

This art is on long term loan to Krannert Art Museum from the United States Government and is cared for as part of the museum collection.

Name: KAM Exhibition | Art Since 1948
Location: Main Level, Rosann Gelvin Noel Gallery
description: With strengths in surrealism, abstract painting, mid-century kinetic and light works, and art addressing powerful themes of history, land use, and identity, "Art Since 1948" surveys the collection and encourages formal and conceptual connections across six decades.

Name: KAM Exhibition | Reinstallation of European and American Art
Location: Main Level, Bow and Trees Galleries
description: The Bow and Trees Galleries, which have been freshly painted with new colors, feature thoughtful reinterpretations of KAMs collection of European and American art from the 1300s to 1950.

Name: Spurlock Museum exhibit | In Her ClosetHow to Make a Drag Queen
Location: Spurlock Museum, 600 S Gregory St, Urbana
description: When you hear drag queen, what comes to mind? The popularity of drag has exploded in recent years, and so have the questions and curiosities related to drag artistry. This exhibit explores these questions and curates a selection of costumes and materials loaned by several drag performers connected to the local area.

Name: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly: Conservation Treatments and Decision Making Through the Ages
description: While contemporary conservators strive to apply innovative modern conservation treatments for our objects, we see the good, the bad, and the ugly past repairs through the ages in our collections every day. In this exhibition, we bring together examples--many drawn from our own Rare Book & Manuscript Library--to show the dynamic practice of modern book & paper conservation.
